name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $url
desc: Returns: An absolute URI that is used to identify this measure when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this measure is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the measure is stored on different servers.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: An absolute URI that is used to identify this measure when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authori

name: $identifier
desc: Returns: A formal identifier that is used to identify this measure when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

name: $addidentifier
desc: A formal identifier that is used to identify this measure when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A formal identifier that is used to identify this measure when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

name: $::version
desc: Returns: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the measure when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the measure author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active artifacts.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the measure when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the measure author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it mi

name: $::name
desc: Returns: A natural language name identifying the measure. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A natural language name identifying the measure. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

name: $title
desc: Returns: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the measure.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the measure.

name: $subtitle
desc: Returns: An explanatory or alternate title for the measure giving additional information about its content.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: An explanatory or alternate title for the measure giving additional information about its content.

name: $status
desc: Returns: The status of this measure. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The status of this measure. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

name: $experimental
desc: Returns: A Boolean value to indicate that this measure is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A Boolean value to indicate that this measure is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

name: $date
desc: Returns: The date  (and optionally time) when the measure was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the measure changes.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The date  (and optionally time) when the measure was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the measure changes.

name: $publisher
desc: Returns: The name of the organization or individual that published the measure.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The name of the organization or individual that published the measure.

name: $contact
desc: Returns: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

name: $addcontact
desc: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

name: $description
desc: Returns: A free text natural language description of the measure from a consumer's perspective.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A free text natural language description of the measure from a consumer's perspective.

name: $useContext
desc: Returns: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate measure instances.

name: $adduseContext
desc: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate measure instances.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist w

name: $jurisdiction
desc: Returns: A legal or geographic region in which the measure is intended to be used.

name: $addjurisdiction
desc: A legal or geographic region in which the measure is intended to be used.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A legal or geographic region in which the measure is intended to be used.

name: $purpose
desc: Returns: Explanation of why this measure is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Explanation of why this measure is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

name: $usage
desc: Returns: A detailed description, from a clinical perspective, of how the measure is used.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A detailed description, from a clinical perspective, of how the measure is used.

name: $copyright
desc: Returns: A copyright statement relating to the measure and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the measure.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A copyright statement relating to the measure and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the measure.

name: $approvalDate
desc: Returns: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

name: $lastReviewDate
desc: Returns: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

name: $effectivePeriod
desc: Returns: The period during which the measure content was or is planned to be in active use.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The period during which the measure content was or is planned to be in active use.

name: $topic
desc: Returns: Descriptive topics related to the content of the measure. Topics provide a high-level categorization grouping types of measures that can be useful for filtering and searching.

name: $addtopic
desc: Descriptive topics related to the content of the measure. Topics provide a high-level categorization grouping types of measures that can be useful for filtering and searching.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Descriptive topics related to the content of the measure. Topics provide a high-level categorization grouping types of measures that can be useful for filtering and searching.

name: $author
desc: Returns: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

name: $addauthor
desc: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

name: $editor
desc: Returns: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

name: $addeditor
desc: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

name: $reviewer
desc: Returns: An individual or organization primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

name: $addreviewer
desc: An individual or organization primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: An individual or organization primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

name: $endorser
desc: Returns: An individual or organization responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

name: $addendorser
desc: An individual or organization responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: An individual or organization responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

name: $relatedArtifact
desc: Returns: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.

name: $addrelatedArtifact
desc: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.

name: $library
desc: Returns: A reference to a Library resource containing the formal logic used by the measure.

name: $addlibrary
desc: A reference to a Library resource containing the formal logic used by the measure.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A reference to a Library resource containing the formal logic used by the measure.

name: $disclaimer
desc: Returns: Notices and disclaimers regarding the use of the measure or related to intellectual property (such as code systems) referenced by the measure.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Notices and disclaimers regarding the use of the measure or related to intellectual property (such as code systems) referenced by the measure.

name: $scoring
desc: Returns: Indicates how the calculation is performed for the measure, including proportion, ratio, continuous-variable, and cohort. The value set is extensible, allowing additional measure scoring types to be represented.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Indicates how the calculation is performed for the measure, including proportion, ratio, continuous-variable, and cohort. The value set is extensible, allowing additional measure scoring types to be represented.

name: $compositeScoring
desc: Returns: If this is a composite measure, the scoring method used to combine the component measures to determine the composite score.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: If this is a composite measure, the scoring method used to combine the component measures to determine the composite score.

name: $::type
desc: Returns: Indicates whether the measure is used to examine a process, an outcome over time, a patient-reported outcome, or a structure measure such as utilization.

name: $addtype
desc: Indicates whether the measure is used to examine a process, an outcome over time, a patient-reported outcome, or a structure measure such as utilization.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Indicates whether the measure is used to examine a process, an outcome over time, a patient-reported outcome, or a structure measure such as utilization.

name: $riskAdjustment
desc: Returns: A description of the risk adjustment factors that may impact the resulting score for the measure and how they may be accounted for when computing and reporting measure results.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A description of the risk adjustment factors that may impact the resulting score for the measure and how they may be accounted for when computing and reporting measure results.

name: $rateAggregation
desc: Returns: Describes how to combine the information calculated, based on logic in each of several populations, into one summarized result.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Describes how to combine the information calculated, based on logic in each of several populations, into one summarized result.

name: $rationale
desc: Returns: Provides a succinct statement of the need for the measure. Usually includes statements pertaining to importance criterion: impact, gap in care, and evidence.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Provides a succinct statement of the need for the measure. Usually includes statements pertaining to importance criterion: impact, gap in care, and evidence.

name: $clinicalRecommendationStatement
desc: Returns: Provides a summary of relevant clinical guidelines or other clinical recommendations supporting the measure.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Provides a summary of relevant clinical guidelines or other clinical recommendations supporting the measure.

name: $improvementNotation
desc: Returns: Information on whether an increase or decrease in score is the preferred result (e.g., a higher score indicates better quality OR a lower score indicates better quality OR quality is within a range).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Information on whether an increase or decrease in score is the preferred result (e.g., a higher score indicates better quality OR a lower score indicates better quality OR quality is within a range).

name: $definition
desc: Returns: Provides a description of an individual term used within the measure.

name: $adddefinition
desc: Provides a description of an individual term used within the measure.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Provides a description of an individual term used within the measure.

name: $guidance
desc: Returns: Additional guidance for the measure including how it can be used in a clinical context, and the intent of the measure.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Additional guidance for the measure including how it can be used in a clinical context, and the intent of the measure.

name: $group
desc: Returns: A group of population criteria for the measure.

name: $addgroup
desc: A group of population criteria for the measure.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A group of population criteria for the measure.

name: $supplementalData
desc: Returns: The supplemental data criteria for the measure report, specified as either the name of a valid CQL expression within a referenced library, or a valid FHIR Resource Path.

name: $addsupplementalData
desc: The supplemental data criteria for the measure report, specified as either the name of a valid CQL expression within a referenced library, or a valid FHIR Resource Path.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The supplemental data criteria for the measure report, specified as either the name of a valid CQL expression within a referenced library, or a valid FHIR Resource Path.
